location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.269 of 1855 from Captain Arnold Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Henry Anderson, Secretary to the Government of Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter and its enclosures are related to an incident of piracy committed against a Bahrain boat by subjects of Aboothabee [Abu Dhabi], first reported by Kemball in December 1854. The enclosed items (a report of the incident by the British Agent at Bahrain, Hajee Jassim [Hajjī Jāsim] is mentioned but not enclosed) include:1. The translation of list of the property plundered from the vessel (folio 123);2. Letter no.262 of 1855 (folios 124-25) from Kemball to Commodore R. Ethersey, Commanding Officer Persian Gulf Squadron, dated 6 august 1855, containing instructions for the pursual of reparations for the act of piracy;3. The translation of a letter (folios 126-27) from Shaikh Zayid bin Khaleefa [Zayd bin Khalīfah] chief of Abu Dhabi, to Kemball, dated 3 July 1855. Shaikh Zayid relates the circumstances of his predecessor’s deposition and flight, and pledges himself to the maritime peace treaty.Folios 121 and 122 are blank sheets.
